channel.title: Bah
channel.description:
So yea.. Went go get Sky+HD Multiroom
Sky came out and because there is a huge trench underneith our current sky dish they cannot get to it for "Safety reasons"
So they turned round and said, We'll leave ALL the stuff needed to set up a new dish on the roof.. Just get someone to come out and fit it.
Must have rang about 8 companies in my immediate area and they all want a minimum of £70 -.-
Meanwhile Sky have started charging us for Multiroom as they have left the box.

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

I’d rather not pirate,

Read up on how to wire these things up…

Looks like its just a case of adding the connectors on and putting the wire through the wall and screwing it into the LNB on the satalite… Doesnt look a hard job at all.
Just need to find someone with a long enough ladder haha

So imma ring round tomoz and if i cant find anyone ill do it myself.

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @eXemplar eXemplar
item.description:
@eXemplar wrote:

There’s lots of legitimate ways for people to get content these days, especially if you considered paying that kinda money for even just installation.

And yes, pirating could be your form of boycotting this crap, but it could also augment the content you’d be willing to pay for anyway. Not to mention you could then get your own dvb-s equipment in your media centre and have a much greater control over the watching and recording of the content you’re paying for.

Read full topic

^ Dirty pirate

item.title: Bah

item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

This would really be pissing me off. I feel sorry for you. Stressssful.

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

guy came out this morning… Said he couldnt fit it to the chimney as we dont have one… Even tho theres a poll there ready to have a dish fitted to it… He said he wanted £120 to fit it to the back of the building… i told him im not paying that much … Fucking joke.

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

this remind me of a story about a bee’s nest

My grandfather in Hyde Park, New York had this huge in one of the box’s on the Telephone poll that he wanted removed for obvious reasons. He called the city and asked them to do something about it. The city referred him to the local electric company (Central Hudson) who came out to inspect the nest. They told him that the bee’s nest was inside a Telephone company (ATT) box and that they wouldn’t touch it. So he called ATT and asked them to come remove the bee’s nest ATT comes out inspects the nest and then tells him they won’t do anything because a cable company (Time Warner) has some wires near the entrance of the box. So he calls Time Warner to come out and remove the bee’s. Time Warner comes out and says “You have a bee’s nest we are not equipped to care of this” and referrers him to pest control. Pest control came out and removed the bee’s nest for a fee of $175 and was told to go after the companies to refund him. My grandfather passed away before any company was willing to give him a refund for the bee’s. Two weeks ago my grandmother got a check for the sum of $175usd from Central Hudson (The power company)

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @Thebeanie TheBeanie
item.description:
@Thebeanie wrote:

Okay a few things i didnt say.

We already have Sky. its multiroom im getting. Normally multiroom would plug into your current dish but as i say… buildings are gonna be built so theres no point doing it there and then having to pay for someone later on to move it anyway

Sky dont do roof’s apparently… And ours is 3 storys up.

Im not going to do it my self because i dont even know what im doing.

i think they wont put a hold on the charge because they cant tell wheter i have connected it or not… so it would be too easy to connect it and not say.

Rang a guy and he said he’d be able to do it all inclusive for £40 on thursday morning so got that booked

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

oh also, if you do decide to DIY, one piece of advice: the lnb<->box connection is live when the box is connected to the power, it uses it for polarisation switching and shit

thats an amusing thing to discover when cutting into a cable on a ladder

luckily it was my uncle who was cutting the cable, so all i got was a good laugh after i realised he wasnt gonna fall off

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

though thinking about it, the fact they wouldnt put a hold on the charge while you sorted it out, when it was the engineer they provided who wasnt equipped to do the job (lets face it, theres a safe way to do it, you dont live on the edge of the grand canyon) is pretty bullshit.

did you actaully ask them about holding off the charge for now?

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

[me=Lothy]shrugs[/me]

We have Foxtel in Australia, and one other competing provider afaik. I know that Foxtel definitely does the installation of the dish in entirety, as part of the service.

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

nor does mounting the dish if you already have the mounts in place

but you’re right, its less of an easy thing to do. which is why the installers exist.

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

What you need to consider though is the ability of a reasonable person to plug their router in. It doesn’t require any third-party involvement, such as work by a tradesman.

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

except they are provisioning the service, they’re just not setting up your equipment for you. it’s the equivalent of expecting the isp to plug in your router legally i expect.

iirc multiroom is just a multiport lnb, you might even be able to fit it on your current dish, though if you have one of those tiny ones it probably is a good idea to put a proper dish up.

if you’re not against getting up on the roof (and can do it safely) it’s really not that hard to fit yourself, i did my dvb-s installation myself and thats on the same satellites as sky digital (28.8e astra)

edit2: obviously if you dont wanna do it yourself complain first and then pay for the installer. complain louddd lol

Read full topic

item.title: Bah
item.dc:creator: @lothy Lothy
item.description:
@lothy wrote:

Is that even legal? If they haven’t made the service usable then surely they can’t be meeting their contractual obligations with the regards to the provision of that service.

Ring up, complain, and if they don’t fix the problem then you simply escalate it to the appropriate authority.
We have ombudsmen in Australia which handle this sort of dispute; I imagine you would have a similar system in place.

Read full topic

item.description:
